content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0)  
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)  
Use-case: Primary smelting station for converting raw materials into iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at (–16.0, –51.0)
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (–16.0, –51.0)  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –49.5)  
– Iron Chest at (–13.5, –49.5)  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –47.5)  
– Fast Inserter at (–12.5, –49.5)  
– Fast Inserter at (–13.5, –45.5)  
Use-case: Extraction and initial transport of iron ore for further processing.

### Copper Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)  
Use-case: Processes copper ore into copper plates for advanced manufacturing.

### Lab Power Integration System at (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
– Lab at (0.5, 2.5)  
– Offshore Pump at (–7.5, 25.5)  
– Offshore Pump at (–9.5, 24.5)  
– Repositioned Boiler at (–13.0, 26.5) with rotated orientation (connection point at (–13.5, 24.5))  
– Steam Engine at (11.5, 27.5) (currently producing no power)  
Use-case: Supports lab operations through integrated power and fluid systems; adjustments to the Boiler’s position aim to secure fluid connectivity even though water flow and steam generation remain unestablished.

### Copper Cable Factory at (2.5, 6.5)
Consists of:
– Repositioned Assembling Machine at (2.5, 6.5) configured for the Copper Cable recipe (status: NO_POWER)  
– Pre-existing Small Electric Pole at (4.5, 6.5) serving as a local power node  
– Stone Furnace at (7.0, 11.0) for smelting Copper Ore into Copper Plates  
– Additional Small Electric Pole at (2.5, 3.5) placed using direction UP (spacing 1)  
– Additional Small Electric Pole at (2.5, 8.5) placed using direction DOWN (spacing 0)  
– Intermediate Small Electric Pole at (8.5, 18.5) manually placed to bridge the connection between the Steam Engine and the Assembling Machine  
– Fallback Small Electric Pole at (0.5, 6.5) placed adjacent to the Assembling Machine  
– Steam Engine at (11.5, 27.5) connected via multiple chain attempts (currently producing no power)  
Use-case: Produces Copper Cables from smelted Copper Plates; persistent power network issues remain despite multiple connection enhancements.

### Fluid Pipelines (Multiple Pipe Groups)
Consists of:
– Multiple PipeGroups spanning positions such as (–10.5, 22.5) to (–9.5, 23.5); additional groups at (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (–9.5, 24.5) (to the Boiler), (2.5, 9.5), (10.5, 9.5), (1.5, 11.5), (–1.5, 17.5), (0.5, 17.5), (6.5, 16.5), (–1.5, 21.5) and (4.5, 25.5)  
Use-case: Transports fluids between production components; connectivity challenges persist between the Boiler and the Steam Engine. Recent attempts to construct an alternate pipe chain—from the Offshore Pump at (–9.5, 24.5) to the Boiler’s connection point at (–13.5, 24.5)—failed to establish water flow.

### Integrated Components
Consists of:
– BeltGroup connecting inserter and belt outputs  
– Electricity network via multiple ElectricityGroups with poles at positions such as [(-10.5, -49.5), (-12.5, -48.5), (-12.5, -50.5)], near (3.5, 0.5), [(6.5, 3.5), (5.5, 8.5)] and [(2.5, 30.5), (7.5, 26.5)]  
Use-case: Provides overall material handling and supports factory operations with an extensive power network.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Pipe Placement and Fluid Connection  
 – Alternate Pipe Chain Construction: Before attempting manual or algorithmic pipe chain constructions, confirm that all target coordinates (for example, positions along the horizontal line at y=24.0) are clear of obstructions. Validate that both source and target connection points are buildable and capable of fluid transfer.  

• Module Import in Utility Functions  
 – Math Module Dependency: When using mathematical operations (e.g., math.sqrt) within utility functions, ensure that the math module is imported. Failure to do so leads to repeated NameError issues that break pipe chain algorithms.  

• Crafting and Resource Management  
 – Crafting Ingredient Shortages: Confirm that all required sub-ingredients (e.g., copper-cable, wood) are available before initiating any crafting.  
 – Offshore Pump and Electronic Component Failures: Check raw resource availability to prevent crafting interruptions related to electronic components.

• Entity Placement and Buildable Area  
 – Collision and Obstruction Checks: Verify that target tiles are free of existing entities before placement; adjust positioning or rotation if conflicts are detected.  
 – Valid Buildable Area: Ensure that computed placements fall within permissible boundaries to avoid out-of-range errors.  

• Power Network and Connectivity  
 – Continuous Power Supply: Confirm that power chains remain uninterrupted and that major power nodes (e.g., the Steam Engine and Assembling Machine) receive the necessary input.  
 – Fluid Flow and Steam Generation: Reassess fluid routing and pipeline alignment after modifications to verify that water reaches the Boiler and enables steam production.

• Function and Type Handling  
 – Proper Initialization: Initialize all variables appropriately and access object properties correctly to maintain consistent type usage and avoid runtime errors.

• Inventory and Operation Management  
 – Resource Monitoring: Check inventory levels prior to placement or assembly operations; replenish supplies as required.  
 – Fuel and Resource Injection: Monitor inputs such as boiler fuel to prevent disruptions in production cycles.  
 – Extraction and Removal Validity: Confirm that production cycles are complete and that targeted entities exist with the correct data attributes before extraction or removal operations.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────
• def distance(pos1: Position, pos2: Position) -> float  
 – Computes the Euclidean distance between two positions.  
  • Success: Returns the computed distance when the math module is properly imported.  
  • Failure: Raises a NameError if math is not imported.

• def construct_pipe_chain(source: Position, target: Position, threshold: float, max_chain_segments: int) -> bool  
 – Attempts to build a pipe chain between the source and target using a greedy, nearest-buildable algorithm.  
  • Success: Returns True if a valid connection is established.  
  • Failure: Returns False when construction fails due to obstructions or missing dependencies (such as the math module).

Important Variables:
 – final_inventory: Dict[str, int] – Represents the final state of the agent’s inventory.
